text: Ken Sparks (February 25, 1944 – March 29, 2017) was an American football coach and player. He was born in Knoxville, Tennessee. == Career == Sparks served as the head football coach at Carson–Newman University in Jefferson City, Tennessee from 1980 until his retirement at the end of the 2016 season. He was the record-holder for the most wins as a coach in NCAA Division II history. He won five NAIA Championships (1983–1984, 1986, 1988–1989). He retired on November 2016. == Death == Sparks died March 29, 2017 in Knoxville from prostate cancer, aged 73.Ken Sparks, coaching icon at Carson-Newman, dies at 73 ==References== ==Other websites== * Carson–Newman profile Category:1944 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Tennessee Category:American football players Category:American football coaches Category:Sportspeople from Knoxville, Tennessee
title: Ken Sparks
